sentences.english: That's why it could be therapeutic.
sentences.chinese: 这就是它能够疗伤的原因。

sentences.english: “Try not to use the kids as therapists,” says Breuner.
sentences.chinese: “不要用孩子来疗伤”布鲁纳说。

sentences.english: Andy and Rooster MacBride went by way of the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: 安迪和卢斯特还先被送到监狱的医务室疗伤。

sentences.english: Time may be a great healer, but it's a lousy beautician.
sentences.chinese: 时间也许是很好的疗伤者，却是个很差的美容师。

sentences.english: There is power and healing in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 这是感恩的力量和疗伤作用。

sentences.english: The Samurai Blue have three months to lick their wounds.
sentences.chinese: “蓝武士”有三个月的疗伤时间。

sentences.english: My grandfather and uncle were forced to return to their village until his recovery.
sentences.chinese: 祖父和叔父被迫返回他们的村庄疗伤。

sentences.english: Shi ZhengYuXiang narration know feelings have been hurt, so she wants to accompany his healing.
sentences.chinese: 仕筠知道郑雨翔感情受到的伤害，所以她要陪他疗伤。

sentences.english: It's not that self-medicating is necessarily bad — but you should give yourself parameters.
sentences.chinese: 自我疗伤并不糟糕，但是你必须给自己一个参照标准。

definition: internal injury/disorder of internal organs (due to improper nutrition, overexertion etc)
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]
to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)
to get well/to heal/to recuperate/to convalesce/convalescence/to nurse
to detoxify/to relieve fever (in Chinese medicine)
